subject: Swimming
Zippers
lead_paragraph: Australian swimmers 18 years and under will be barred from wearing full bodysuits in competition under bylaws passed by the Swimming Australia board. The board also agreed with other leading swimming nations to ask the governing body FINA not to approve further swimsuits and ban the use of multilayer suits after some competitors in Beijing wore several suits to help with buoyancy. Under the new bylaws, male swimsuits cannot extend above the waist or below the knees, and female suits must have open back and shoulder designs. Zippers and other types of fastening systems have been barred.
